intro: Senghasia trullata, commonly known as the yellow-bellied starling tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in dry forests and woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
